title: Derivative of a function defined as an inverse

content.question: Let f be a differentiable function such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE4@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B2A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C25@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C22@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The function g is differentiable and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4039@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3971@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: The value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3971@</annotation> </semantics> </math> cannot be determined from the information given.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
